brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators performed a 12-week, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled human
      trial to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Cauliflower Mushroom extract on promotion of
      immunity. The investigators measured promotion of immunity parameters , including
      Cytotoxicity, Cytokine (IL-4, IL-10, IFN- γ, TNF-α), and CBC (WBC, RBC, Hb, Hct, MCV, MCH,
      MCHC, PLT), and monitored their blood pressure.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Cauliflower Mushroom Extract on Promotion of Immunity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Males and females 30-65 years old

          -  Weight within ±30% of ideal body weight

          -  Able to give informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  WBC concentration below 3000 ㎕

          -  Allergic or hypersensitive to any of the ingredients in the test products

          -  Diagnosed of gastrointestinal disease such as Immune-related diseases, severe
             hepatic, renal failure, and diabetes

          -  History of reaction to any of the test products or of gastrointestinal diseases such
             as Crohn's disease or gastrointestinal surgery

          -  History of alcohol or substance abuse

          -  Participation in any other clinical trials within past 2 months

          -  Laboratory test, medical or psychological conditions deemed by the investigators to
             interfere with successful participation in the study

          -  Pregnant or lactating women etc.

facility.name: Clinical Trial Center for Functional Foods; Chonbuk National University Hospital

primary_outcome.description: Cytotoxicity was measured in study visit 1(0 week) and visit 3(12 week). cytotoxicity was measured by NK cell activity. Cytotoxicity (%) = (experimental release - spontaneous release) / (maximum release - spontaneous release) x 100
Cytokine (IL-4, IL-10, IFN- γ, TNF-α) was measured in study visit 1(0 week) and visit 3(12 week).
primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Cytokine (IL-4, IL-10, IFN- γ, TNF-α)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Principal Investigator, Clinical Trial Center for Functional Foods

secondary_outcome.description: CBC (WBC, RBC, Hb, Hct, MCV, MCH, MCHC, PLT) was measured in study visit 1(0 week) and visit 3(12 week).
secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in CBC (WBC, RBC, Hb, Hct, MCV, MCH, MCHC, PLT)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Prevention
